title: Business School
description: Michael is a guest speaker for Ryan's business class, but they have a falling-out after Michael finds out that Ryan spoke negatively about Dunder-Mifflin. And back at the office, Dwight tries to kill a bat that he found in the ceiling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, Kevin, nice of you to join us, where were you?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My tire blew out on the way here, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I almost died. I... I went into this skid--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pop quiz.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ...What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why is today a special day?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I almost died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today's a special day, because I am being honored as a... visiting... professor, special lecturer, emeritus... how did you, how did you...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You will be a guest speaker... in my Emerging Enterprises class.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: In business school, Kevin. Business school.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: If you bring your boss to class, it automatically bumps you up a full letter grade. So... I'd be stupid not to do it, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A boss is like a teacher. And I am like the cool teacher. Like Mr. Handell. Mr. Handell would hang out with us, and he would tell us awesome jokes. And he actually hooked up with one of the students. Um... and then like twelve other kids came forward. It was in all the papers. ... Really ruined eighth grade for us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here we go. College Roadshow. Gotta bring our... A game. What was the most inspiring thing I've ever said to you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Don't be an idiot." Changed my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whenever I'm about to do something, I think, "Would an idiot do that?" And if they would, I do not do that thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Will they throw their hats, you think?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A lot of times, at a... school, or naval academy, after a rousing speech, the crowd would throw its hats high into the air.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Y-You understand nobody's graduating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know, I know. I'm just saying if they did throw their hats I've got a great line for that: "May your hats fly as high as your dreams." ... That was a pretty good line.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ...It doesn't apply.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I understand! Wow. Relax, spazzy boy. Sometimes you're such a little spaz! [pokes Ryan] Whoa, hey!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Quit it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have fun.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I can't for your art show tonight.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, just so you know, it's just the students from my class in a little studio.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: I-I wouldn't miss it for the world.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm really happy to be back with Roy. I think it shows maturity. Maturity and dignity. ... Is that braggy? I don't mean it to be braggy.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Love ya.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam's with Roy. I'm with Karen. And, uh, Brangelina is with Frangelina. Movin' on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I can't believe you're back together with Roy!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah! We have such a solid foundation, you know.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God. You're so in love now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Oh, you should come to my art show, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, art show!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I mean, it's not a big deal, but I think a lot of people from the office will be there.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: ...Oh... yeah. Definitely... I'll be there. For sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Campus. Brings back so many memories. ... That I would have made. Hey. Frisbee. Check that out. Aww! What do you say we get our Fris on before class? [runs over, throws frisbee] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: College Student
quotes.text: ....Dude.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...Oh my God. Animal stool. [jumps on desk]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dwight, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Solving a mystery, if that's quite alright with you. [opens ceiling tile] Come to Papa. Okay, ladies and gentlemen, what we have here is a bird that has been trapped in a vent. Fortunately I have found it befo-BAT! BAAAT! BAT!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: BAAAAT! BAT! NO! EVERYONE REMAIN CALM! There it goes!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Goooood bye.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on ground] ... Please don't let that stupid thing near me...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, this is it. Ryan is doing my intro right now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ...Dunder-Mifflin can't compete with the modern chains, and management is unwilling, or unable, to adapt. Their customers are dying off...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't hear what he's saying, but he looks like he's really into it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have... a bat... in the office.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: The simple solution would be to open a window... if we had... windows that could open.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Poop is raining from the ceilings. Poop!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. Thanks. [hangs up phone] Animal control will be here at six.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: At Six?! No, that is unacceptable. Okay, Jim, you are the number two in this office. You need to step up and show some leadership.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry what did you say? So wierd...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? What's so wierd?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The bat, I mean, I know I felt it bite me, but look. There's no mark. I feel so... tingly... so strangely powerful... [shrugs] Oh well.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And now, without further ado, I present the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton, Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello everyone, I am Michael Scott. And I would like to start today by inspiring you. May I borrow someone's textbook, please? Thank you. What have we here? Ooh. Economics. Very, very interesting. [rips pages out of book] You cannot learn from books. Replace these pages with life lessons, and then, you will have... a book... that is worth its weight in gold. [gives book back] I know these are expensive, um, but the lesson is priceless. Good. Alright. I think you're inspired. Shall we proceed? There are four kinds of business: Tourism. Food service. Railroads, and sales. And hospitals slash manufacturing. And air travel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs] This is your job, Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ow!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Oh, what happened?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That bread on your desk? I just picked it up. It's white hot.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: But Jim, this garlic bread is cold.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? ... No. It burned me. I... bizarre.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No... no. One crisis at a time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If a vampire bat was in the U.S., it would make sense for it to come to a "sylvania." Like PENN-sylvania. Now that doesn't mean that Jim is going to become a vampire. Only that he carries the vampiric germ.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, you wanna start a business. How do you start? What do you need? Well, first of all, you need a building. And secondly, you need supply. You need something to sell. Now this could be anything. It could be... a... thingamajig. Or a... a whosi-whatsi. Or... [pulls out a candy bar] a Whatchamacallit [throws bar]. Now, you need to sell those in order to have a PayDay [takes out a PayDay, throws it]. And, if you sell enough of them, you will make a 100 Grand [throws 100 Grand bar]. [pulls out a Snickers] Satisfied?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, this looks great. I'd, I'd love to be there, but my daughter's play is tonight. ... Damnit! You know, one of the other parents will probably videotape it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! No, you should go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, it's important to support local art, you know. And what they do is not art.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I'm seeing some confused... faces out there. Let me slow down a little bit. Break this down. Okay. The more stickers you sell, the more profit, fancy word for money, you have to buy PlayStations and Beanie Babies.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...And products!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What we normally do here is more of a question and answer thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... okay, I was just kind of getting it going. Um, alright. Well, okay, we can do questions. Okay. Very good. First hand up.

quotes.speaker: Business Student #1
quotes.text: Sir, as a company that primary distributes paper, how have you adapted your business model to function in an increasingly paperless world?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We can't overestimate the value of computers. Yes, they are great for playing games and forwarding funny emails. But real business is done on paper, okay? Write that down. [everyone types on their laptops]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey Jim, here's the aspirin you wanted.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, thank God. I have such a headache from that glare.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: What glare?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The glare off Angela's crucifix? It's blinding.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't have a lot of experience with vampires, but I have hunted werewolves. I shot one once. But by the time I got to it, it had turned back into my neighbor's dog.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Extraordinary events call for extraordinary actions. We form an allegiance-

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: -to use sudden violence.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you have the tools to turn a wooden mop handle into a stake?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What size?

quotes.speaker: Business Student #2
quotes.text: What do you say to a customer who wants to leave you for the convenience and savings of a nationwide chain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...I say you will miss our service, and I absolutely guarantee you'll come back.

quotes.speaker: Business Student #2
quotes.text: Has anyone ever come back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...We don't want them back, 'cause they're... stupid.

quotes.speaker: Business Student #3
quotes.text: How far has your Herfindahl index declined since the merger?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nice try, how's your Pollack-says-what index?

quotes.speaker: Business Student #3
quotes.text: ...What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, Kowalsky. Um, can we get on track here?

quotes.speaker: Business Student #1
quotes.text: By your own employee's calculation you'll be obsolete in the next five to ten years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...Wait, Ryan said that?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What are you doing? You'd better not hurt that little bat.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Animals can't feel pain.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Don't hurt that bat, Creed! It's a living thing with feelings and a family!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Flush him towards the door. On my go... NOW!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: AHH! KILL IT! KILL IT! KILL IIIT!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [locks bat in break room] I... am a hero!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah sure, you know business, sitting up here in your ivory tower. And your ebony tower. You know what? Tell you one thing, Dunder-Mifflin is here to stay.

quotes.speaker: Business Student #2
quotes.text: But how can you compete against a company with the resources of a nationwide chain?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David will always beat Goliath.

quotes.speaker: Business Student #1
quotes.text: But there's five Goliaths, there's... Staples, Officemax...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah. You know what else is facing five Goliaths? America. Al-Qaeda, global warming, sex predators... mercury poisoning. So do we just give up? Is that what we're learning in business school?

quotes.speaker: Business Student #1
quotes.text: But in the big picture...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dunder-Mifflin is the big picture! Can't you understand that? No, you can't. You're too young. Ryan... has never made a sale. And he started a fire trying to make a cheesy pita. And everybody thinks he's a tease. Well you know what? He doesn't know anything, and neither do you. [walks out] SO SUCK ON THAT!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ...It wasn't personal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Business is always personal. It's the most personal thing in the world. When we get back to the office, pack your things.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Pack my-?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You heard me, pack your things.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I really want to come out!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Good night, Mary Beth!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So... you're cool to just wait here for animal control?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Animal control? I've been controlling animals since I was six.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cool. Okay. I'm gonna go home and lie down, draw the shades... there's just so much sun in here... bye Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Goodbye Jim. And good luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim is on a path now. An eternal journey, and I wish him well. But I have a destiny in this realm. Specifically, in the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ...And it's all from the same series.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Called 'Impressions.'

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not that I call myself an impressionist, per se.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Maybe one day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I hope so.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I still need... you know, my breakthrough, or whatever. [Woman leaves, Roy enters] Hey, babe, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Good. Alright I brought my brother, huh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Kenny.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: Hey Pam.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: How 'bout this, huh? I show up with my brother, and, no one from work is here? That's... pretty cool, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Magic time. Gyeeeaahhh! [puts bag over Meredith's head]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! Get off! Get off me! Get off me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hold still, woman!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Get off me! Get it off! Ahhhh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...[captures bat in bag] ... You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: It's cool if I go, right? I mean, I looked at all of them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I'll just, I'll drive myself home.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: To my place?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe, I'm a little tired.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Your art.. was the prettiest art of... all art.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look, I'm sorry, okay? I was just trying to do my presentation, and... of course, I was wrong to suggest that Dunder-Mifflin might ever go out of business. But you don't have to fire me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fire you? No, no no. You are moving... to the annex.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: To the annex? Where... Kelly is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A good manager doesn't fire people. He hires people and inspires people. ... People, Ryan. And people will never go out of business.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're the one who said we needed more culture.

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: This is culture to you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's her first try.

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: Yeah, on Van Gogh's first try, he drew the hands of the peasants.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Meaning what?

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: Meaning, real art takes courage, okay? And honesty.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, those aren't Pam's strong points.

quotes.speaker: Gil
quotes.text: Yeah, exactly. That's why this is... motel art.

quotes.speaker: Artist
quotes.text: Thanks for coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam-casso! Sorry I'm late, I had to race across town.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! You did these... freehand?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My God, these could be tracings! Ohh! Look at this one. Wow! You nailed it. [sighs] ... How much?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't see a... price.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um... you wanna buy it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, yeah. Yeah, we have to have it for the office. I mean, there's my... window, and there's my car! That your car?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is our building... and we sell paper. ... I am really proud of you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [hugs Michael] ... Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you have something in your pocket?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...Chunky. Do you want half?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is... a message. It is an inspiration, it is... a source of beauty. And without paper, it could not have happened. Unless, you had a camera.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's only temporary, okay? Don't get excited.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well ultimately I went into business to inspire people. They say those who can't do, teach. I can do both. I teach doing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, here we go... Digest of business terms, CliffsNotes on business economics, and a sales encyclopedia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! That's a lot of books, do you have, umm, one book that sums up all of these.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Those are the books that sum up the other books.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So no?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you reading?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, umm, ever since I started here, I've kept a diary of all my sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, that could be interesting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, it's just mileage mostly, but there's one chapter that I call wisdoms. I'm going to read you a series of statements, and I want you to tell me, on a scale of one to ten, how smart they are.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [clears throat] I am ready.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't do what I say, say what I do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just getting warmed up. Mistakes are just successes that you mess up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm... Five.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This... You know this is a scale of one to ten?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. Do you want me to repeat that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I got it.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [motions to phyllis's desk]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: She's on her honeymoon. She won't be back for six weeks.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'll wait. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Here's a joke for you. Why did Pam hook up with Roy at Phyllis's wedding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You ready?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You know I don't like to participate in the...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why did Pam hook up with Roy at Phyllis's wedding?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really, it's just that I don't like to participate...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Grow up.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's just... I'm sorry... It's gossip, and I don't think it's healthy.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Get over yourself.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, I'm not going to get over myself... it's wrong.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Because Roy use to... [long censor beep]... with the rice... [long censor beep]... [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [laughs] That's disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [still laughing] I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody please stand, and get up on your desks. [goes to stand on desk] Just stand right up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael it's not... It's not...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's, yep a little flimsy. Umm... OK... Ahh... Alright, no more desks. Oh OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a lot of big ideas, and the trick is to get it out of my brain and into theirs, in a way that is easy to swallow. Simple... [holds up snickers] Kids love candy bars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lets try a little... Little social experiment here. Raise your hands if you like to buy things. OK, I see some people who like to buy things. You're it, you are the reason this world rolls along, give yourselves a round of applause. Say, say you want to start a business, and business is all about buying and selling, is it not? So say you want to sell lemonade, or stickers. Something you have to keep in mind, you must, and you might want to jot this down, you must sell the stickers for more than you bought the stickers for.

quotes.speaker: Student #1
quotes.text: How have you adopted your business model to function in an increasingly paperless world?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Oh, I take umbrage to that premise...ses. Umm, let me ask you this:

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: [Karen sees Pam's art show flyer on the cabinet door, she looks around to make sure no one is looking, then proceeds to rip in down, Oscar comes out of the bathroom, Karen acts like she was just looking at it and then walks out of the kitchen]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: BAT!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [comes out of the bathroom... screams... runs back into the bathroom]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is a leader? I asked Jim that, and he said he had never heard the word before. In America, in 2007. He said he knew the word ladder... What an ignoramous.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [Bat hanging from ceiling cleaning itself] I really want to come out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You want rabies? Be my guest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looking with Kevin at the art show flyer] Should be fun.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Your name looks really nice.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Goodnight Mary-Beth.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hope she's OK.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Just goes to show the power of prayer.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You prayed for this?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: In a general sense.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: So cool you're back with Roy. Maybe we can rent that cabin on the lake again this summer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, that'd be nice.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: There'll be two of you and only one of me this time, since Denise left me. So I think it's fair I only pay a third.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah that seems fair.
